designer.0:

Starting out as graphic designer, my commissions included illustrations, print and web design, matte paintings, light projections, and much more.
designer.1: During my work in and for ad agencies like [isobar](http://www.isobar.com/at/en/work/), I had the opportunity to work for brands like Bahlsen, Disney, Danone, Lebenshilfe, LG, Microsoft, Mondeles, UPC, …

linguist.0:
Sadly, we teach languages the same way we teach History or Math.  
New language students are quickly discouraged because it feels like **too much** commitment in **time and effort**. In addition, the course is not revolving around their interests and needs. There has to be a breaking change in _how_ we teach languages.
linguist.1:
I have dedicated a lot of my work life on UI/UX (user interface and user experience) and marketing, while spending my pastime on languages. I learned most of German, English, and French in school, but learned Indonesian, Spanish, a bit of Italian and Haitian Creole (and just started Russian and Swedish) using my own system. 
A lot of shortcomings of **language learning apps** can be counteracted with a lot of what I have learned in computer science, design, and marketing.  
  
<u>As such I have made it my mission to make learning of languages effective and fun!</u>
linguist.2: Using my coding skills I started to create small games for rapid language learning that I will soon share – along with my whole approach – on a blog.
linguist.headline: the Linguist
linguist.subheadline: Learning languages has to be fun.

mathHat.0: I am currently working on an [animation engine for vector graphics](https://github.com/danborufka/danimator) with an according UI to animate paths on a segment point level.
mathHat.1: I started out as Flash programmer, doing small agency work and entering the realm of web design. I got my first job because they stumbled upon my first interactive animation: a dinosaur that would pee himself after having pushed his bladder often enough.
mathHat.2: When I wasn't freelancing as web designer and developer, I had the opportunity to familiarize with the inner workings of agencies ranging from small [one-man](http://www.i-kiu.at/) [shops](http://www.bindertrittenwein.com/) to [multinational](http://www.dentsuaegisnetwork.com/) [networks](http://www.isobar.com).
mathHat.3: I ended up hiring programmers for the teams I lead, consulting other businesses with their coding workflow, and teaching a semester of programming at the [SAE institute](http://www.sae.edu/aut/).
mathHat.4: While at <abbr title='Academy of Art University'>AAU</abbr>, I earned money on the side writing and selling small plugins for Illustrator, After Effects, and Nuke.
